title: notebook template for authoring in quarto
text:
the inclusion or exclusion of this page in the listing (see index.qmd) can be controlled like this


the table of content for each page is controlled in the raw cell in this notebook with the YAML front matter


notebook are never executed by default but can be configured per here
And despite the execution feature of freeze, and the various ways to control it; according to this github issue: > think we have a misconception about what freeze is about. Regardless of the presence of code cells, all files needed for the website are rendered from what I’ve seen. … If I am not mistaken, this means there is a “missing” feature allowing the user to not render at all to HTML if there is no reason, i.e., not only the content of the “page” but any Quarto component involved in that page such as navbar, footer, etc.
So basically when you have computationally expensive notebooks and various collaboraters, it’s best to just render only the notebook you have updated (it’s dependences, like the listing page, will also be rendered):
quarto render notebooks/only_notebook_with_changes.ipynb

# if changes are not with notebooks
quarto render index.qmd


the code block below are quarto specific imports to pay attention to


Code
import plotly.express as px

# need this for plotly charts to render properly: https://stackoverflow.com/a/78749656
import plotly.io as pio
pio.renderers.default = "notebook"


output of cells can be suppressed


Code
print(f'pray to your Father who is in secret...')


or you can show the outputs but not the cell (further documentations can be found here)


and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you.




Code
print("the width of your content is also adjustable like this image (see [doc](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/article-layout.html))")
print("![](https://www.quoteswishesmsg.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Best-Rumi-quotes-1.jpg)")

the width of your content is also adjustable like this image (see doc) 

and there’s more! figures and charts can be displayed side-by-side in columns and rows, read the docs for more!





this method might not be the safest but running locally should be okay:
jupyter notebook --ip='*' --NotebookApp.token='' --NotebookApp.password=''
or
jupyter nbclassic



this post talks about a list of great extension that might help with writing notebooks
However, making these extension configurable in a virtualenv might require different installation steps
And it might not be compatible with some version of notebooks.
So to uninstall the extensions follow these steps

title: notebook template for authoring in quarto
text:
the table of content for each page is controlled in the raw cell in this notebook with the YAML front matter


notebook are never executed by default but can be configured per here
And despite the execution feature of freeze, and the various ways to control it; according to this github issue: > think we have a misconception about what freeze is about. Regardless of the presence of code cells, all files needed for the website are rendered from what I’ve seen. … If I am not mistaken, this means there is a “missing” feature allowing the user to not render at all to HTML if there is no reason, i.e., not only the content of the “page” but any Quarto component involved in that page such as navbar, footer, etc.
So basically when you have computationally expensive notebooks and various collaboraters, it’s best to just render only the notebook you have updated (it’s dependences, like the listing page, will also be rendered):
quarto render notebooks/only_notebook_with_changes.ipynb

# if changes are not with notebooks
quarto render index.qmd


the code block below are quarto specific imports to pay attention to


Code
import plotly.express as px

# need this for plotly charts to render properly: https://stackoverflow.com/a/78749656
import plotly.io as pio
pio.renderers.default = "notebook"


output of cells can be suppressed


Code
print(f'pray to your Father who is in secret...')


or you can show the outputs but not the cell (further documentations can be found here)


and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you.




Code
print("the width of your content is also adjustable like this image (see [doc](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/article-layout.html))")
print("![](https://www.quoteswishesmsg.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Best-Rumi-quotes-1.jpg)")

the width of your content is also adjustable like this image (see doc) 

and there’s more! figures and charts can be displayed side-by-side in columns and rows, read the docs for more!
